info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...LIGHT WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE EARLY THIS AFTERNOON... An approaching low pressure system will continue light precipitation across the northern North Carolina mountains this afternoon. Meanwhile, cold and dry air will persist along the east side of the Appalachians. Isolated areas near the east-facing Blue Ridge escarpment, north of Interstate 40, will remain near freezing and a wintry mix of rain, freezing rain, and sleet is possible in these areas. Although any ice accretion is expected to be light and mainly on elevated surface, some slick spots could develop on roadways, especially bridges and overpasses. Slippery road conditions may last into midday. Drive with extra caution if traveling this morning.
